field.name: TPM1CH0SRC
field.description: TPM1 channel 0 input capture source select

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: TPM0 external clock driven by TPM_CLKIN0 pin

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: TPM0 external clock driven by TPM_CLKIN1 pin

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: TPM1 external clock driven by TPM_CLKIN0 pin

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: TPM1 external clock driven by TPM_CLKIN1 pin

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: UART0_TX pin modulated by TPM1 channel 0 output

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Open drain is disabled on UART0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Open drain is enabled on UART0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: TPM1 channel 0 (A) and channel 1 (B) triggers selected for ADC0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Flash remains enabled during Doze mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Flash is disabled for the duration of Doze mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0000
enumeratedValue.description: 8 KB of program flash memory, 0.25 KB protection region

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0001
enumeratedValue.description: 16 KB of program flash memory, 0.5 KB protection region

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0011
enumeratedValue.description: 32 KB of program flash memory, 1 KB protection region

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0101
enumeratedValue.description: 64 KB of program flash memory, 2 KB protection region

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0111
enumeratedValue.description: 128 KB of program flash memory, 4 KB protection region

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1001
enumeratedValue.description: 256 KB of program flash memory, 8 KB protection region

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1111
enumeratedValue.description: 32 KB of program flash memory, 1 KB protection region

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Internal 1 kHz clock is source to COP

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Bus clock is source to COP

field.name: COPT
field.description: COP Watchdog Timeout\n This write-once field selects the timeout period of the COP. COPT along with the COPCLKS field define the COP timeout period

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: COP timeout after 2^5 LPO cycles or 2^13 bus clock cycles

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: COP timeout after 2^8 LPO cycles or 2^16 bus clock cycles

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: COP timeout after 2^10 LPO cycles or 2^18 bus clock cycles

field.name: SRVCOP
field.description: Sevice COP Register\n Write 0x55 and then 0xAA (in that order) to reset the COP timeout counter, writing any other value will generate a system reset
